headline: Prize-Winning Baby Back Ribs
description: Learn how to grill ribs with this foolproof, simple recipe for spiced baby back ribs slow-cooked over indirect heat until fall-off-the-bone tender.

video.description: Spice-rubbed ribs slow-cooked over indirect heat.
video.name: Prize Winning Baby Back Ribs

name: Prize-Winning Baby Back Ribs

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat a gas grill for high heat, or arrange charcoal briquettes on one side of the barbeque. Lightly oil the grate.
Combine cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and pepper in a small jar; close the lid and shake to mix.

Trim the membrane sheath from the back of each rack. Run a small, sharp knife between the membrane and each rib, and snip off the membrane as much as possible. Sprinkle as much of the rub onto both sides of ribs as desired. To prevent ribs from becoming too dark and spicy, do not thoroughly rub spices into ribs. Store any unused spice mix in a jar for future use.

Place aluminum foil on the lower rack to capture drippings and prevent flare-ups. Lay ribs on the top rack of the grill (away from the coals, if you're using briquettes). Reduce gas heat to low, close lid, and leave ribs undisturbed for 1 hour. Do not lift the lid at all.
Brush ribs with barbecue sauce, and grill for an additional 5 minutes. Serve ribs as a whole rack, or cut between each rib bone and pile individually on a platter.

review.reviewBody: Perfect every time!! This is the only way I make ribs! Time occasionally adjusted depending on size of rack of ribs!
We do not like store bought BBQ sauce and made our own, other than that the spices and the recipe is perfect.
It's not all recipes fault some people can't grill. The recipe was great and we loved it

The recipe in my opinion; first you need an established heated grill temperature for cooking time. I never saw this. None the less. Followed the cooking instructions to the letter. We have a four burner grill heated grill using first and third. Placed ribs as directed on top rack above actual cooking surface between the two burners Cooked one hour. Kim closed. Ribs reach temperature in about an hour and 10 minutes. Turn off the grill lay the ribs on the foil on the rack put on some sauce came back 10 minutes later. Pulled them. They looked nice and juicy. But there it was tough as shoe leather. Yes these were baby backs. So I put them back on the grill on the cooking surface At 350° for about 10 minutes flipping ribs over occasionally Putting some a little burn On each side. Let rest for 5 minutes they were significantly better. Point being I need to know an exact cooking temperature for this recipe. Otherwise it’s guesswork it shouldn’t be
I followed this recipe exactly, except I used my own rub. Perfect cooking times on a gas grill. BEST ribs I've ever cooked!! Family thought so as well.
To be honest, I dont usually give feedback, but, this recipe is that good!! Followed recipe to a TEE, it turn out amazingly good!! *****

This produces perfectly adequate grilled ribs, but it does not produce tender falling off the bone ribs. Since that is what it promises, I have to give it a lot rating. Also, temperature ranges would be helpful. 'Low ' is not the same on everyone's grill!
This was SO EASY and SOOO GOOD!!! I made the recipe exactly as directed-I would not change a thing! :)
Love this recipe!
As recipe stated... turned burners to low and did not peek for the one hour. Ribs were burnt to a crisp. If doing again would use indirect heat or leave for a shorter time.

This recipe was fantastic! I prepared this for a small, southern family reunion. I made a few changes to the preparation, the rub and to the grilling time I had my husband increase to almost 2 hrs. I boiled the ribs with 1 tspn cider vinegar for 5-10 minutes(helped tenderize and reduce grease). I changed the rub ingredients to 1/2 tsp of cumin, paprika, and chili powder. I added 1 tsp garlic powder, 2 Tbsn Kosmos Sweet Honey Pecan Dry Rub. Removal of the membrane was the best tip evah! Seven minutes direct grill at 400 then wrapped in aluminum foil and placed on uppermost grill at lowest temp (250) for 11/2 hrs, then slathered with Carolina sauce, back on grill for few minutes more...absolutely delicious with meat falling off the bone! Everybody loved it!. Ya gotta try it! Helen

OMG! My husband was mortified...we had company and wanted to make something special. Followed this recipe To The Letter and the ribs were burnt to a crisp. We didn't check them because it said not to open the grill. We opened it up because we saw flames shooting out sideways...and there was a huge fire. My husband backed off so he didn't get burned but then came back in carefully and turned off the grill. The flames continued for another 5 minutes--the tin foil gad caught fire with the drippings from the ribs most likely. We turned the grill on high then turned it down to low when we put the ribs on the upper gril. What in the world??!! (my second choice of words....) My friend is still talking about this and we had a bit of a chuckle when the deck and house at least didn't catch fire and we were all safe. We then put on hot dogs and caled it a night. $25 worth of ribs carefully prepared with the rub and membranes removed. Sad.

I made these today by stripping away the membrane then seasoning and baking covered at 300 for 2.5 hours. Then I brushed on the sauce and raised the temp to 425 and baked uncovered for 15 minutes. They were great! Fell off the bone and delicious.
Was excellent! I substituted Sazon for salt and pepper, but stayed true to everything else and they came out great! You have to try this recipe!

These ribs were delish. The only change I would make is to take it easy on the cumin. I also added many spices to the rub - garlic powder, oregano, paprika, chili powder, whatever you like. Otherwise, yum, yum.
Delious!!!

The rub is really good. We've cooked this a few times and we've put the grill on low and even the oven following temps we find online and it isn't nearly cooked in an hour. Great recipe but the temps and time don't appear to be accurate.
It was amazing
absolutely delicious! husband can't wait to have them again!
I didn’t have enough regular paprika so I added some smoked paprika and pork seasoning. Wonderful!
Best Baby Rack Ribs! So easy! Licking finger good! It’s unbelievable that they cook in an hour; 100% satisfied!

The ribs were GREAT my first time making hem, EASY,FAST,DELICIOUS!!! I made a few changes when I made it. . I made the rub spicy with some heat by sprinkling Cayenne Pepper front and back After I spread the rub. . I spread Brown Sugar "ON TOP" of the Cayenne Pepper. That makes it HOT, SWEET, and STICKY !!

Made it and added a pinch of garlic powder and a half cup of brown sugar. Cooked them on 275 degrees for three hours then added sweet baby ray’s on one side baked 20 min. Then on other side for 20 min. They fell off the bones. The dry rub was perfect.

Made as described and they were delicious!! The critic in me thinks I should lower the heat and extend another 30 minutes to get to “fall off the bone” tender. But they were good and tender in under 75 minutes.
Good recipe i recommend boiling of baking in water just so it can get soft and you can achieve that fall of the bone texture worked well for me.

I have a gas grill and the top rack is only small for veggies and what not can’t fir a full rack of ribs. After about 20 minutes I noticed smoke coming out the grill so I opened it and turned off the center 2 burners while leaving the other 3 on low. The ribs basically cooked for 40 minutes at 300 degrees farenheit after the initial crisping on direct heat on low for 20 mins. The ribs came out out good also. I suggest grilling the ribs on direct heat for 5-7 minutes after putting the sauce of your choice. Gives it a chance to caramelize a little more.

This recipe is great, except for the part where you have to finish them in the oven for an hour and half and then sit on the counter for AT LEAST 30 minutes for the juices to shine and the ribs to bend just right

Tasted as advertised. Followed the recipe exactly and results were outstanding. They're not falling off the bone but they're better than that. They're tender and very flavorful. Besides, being falling off the bone is overrated. I can make those kind through a steaming method but cooking on a grill such as this recipe describes it brings out the best in texture, tenderness, and flavor. And it only takes an hour.

I've made this recipe in the oven four or five times. I think it's the best. Going with the original recipe is good but I added half as much garlic powder to the rub as the other items.
 A good spice kick in the barbecue sauce to finish it off is awesome. I can't wait to try it on the grill.
I cooked my ribs in the oven on 350 with the total cook time of 1 1/2 and they came out so good...Thank you I will be using this recipe again.
Great recipe. We’ve enjoyed this a few times.
TOTALLY PERFECT SPICING COMBO! We loved it and have made it several times. Yum!
Excellent flavor. I love the crispy bits to ribs.
I followed the recipe exactly as written and my ribs turned out to be the best I've eaten, ever!
Now you know this recipe must be good if you brave the winter cold to make this grilling recipe. Well worth it!!
Great method. Used our own rub.
This is a fool proof recipe! Easy to find ingredients, simplify get an excellent quality rib, pair it with your favourite bbq sauce and voilà!
Good stuff
Just followed the recipe-quick, easy & very tasty!
I have made these ribs 4 times so far and every time they came out great! A+ and foolproof recipe!
It was awesome. My husband and I enjoyed them immensely. I have some of the rub left, I will try it on some pork chops.
Impossible to trim the membrane from the ribs. I used garlic salt in place of salt. Very good.
Delicious and easy!

Follow the video if you have a gas grill; the printed instructions are misleading with talk of the “lower rack”. Just place the aluminum foil on the rack and the ribs on the foil, as is done in the video. (Cup the foil to contain the grease.) Putting the grill on low keeps the temp at about 450 and the ribs cook in an hour, plus another 10 minutes for the sauce. Wonderful.

The flavour is very nice but the first time I used this receipt the meat was tuff. The second time I added the bar-b-q sauce then rapped them in foil and cocked them for 3 hours, much better. The meat was so tender it came right off the bone.
The freakin bbq and rib skin was caramelized. These ribs were the best I ate yet, awesome recipe!!!
I followed the recipe exactly. The spice rub was great! The ribs were delicious!

Made as is, no changes. 
I’ve never made ribs on grill before, only crockpot. This was SO easy and VERY delicious. My husband ate the whole rack!! We used Sweet Baby Rays bbq sauce at the end. We don’t have a second rack so we put right on the aluminum foil. For us low was registering between 350-400 degrees. Did it one hour, no peeking. Can’t wait to make again!
Great quick way to cook tender baby back ribs. I use various marinades each time the ribs turn out perfect.
Rub was okay. Ribs were the furthest thing from “fall off the bone”. Would not recommend such a short cooking time ever.
These were very easy, perfectly seasoned and gone in seconds!! I will definitely be making them again.

I loved it, my daughter loved it and my grandson loved it (he does not like hot-spicy.). I made the spices as per the recipe, using mild chili powder. I did use one of our favorite bottled dressings and worked fine. I did deviate using hickory chips to smoke and cooked on a coal grill (meat off to the side) for 2 hours. Tender, flavorful and the cumin was fine. My internal temp got to 180 - Looking forward to making again, may try homemade sauce.

This recipe is easy to follow and turned out juicy and tender in the one hour cooking time on a gas grill. The only thing we did different was add 1/2 cup salt to the aluminum foil on the grate to prevent flare up and smoke. They were delicious! Thank you!
They were perfect! Super tinder! This will be my new way of making moving forward!

So easy. SO good! And almost unbelievable. I've done this recipe several times on a gas grill-- everyone is amazed at how easy. Sure, they may not be every bit as good as the pit master's recipe, but I'm happy with delicious and quick.
I trusted this recipe and it's preheat for "high heat". These were burned so bad they inedible.
Delicious but did not fall off the bone.

If you could give zero stars to this then I would. I’ve made riBs many times befor and I’ve never had them so bad I couldn’t eat them. I am throwing away 20 dollars of meat because this recipe is not good. Way too long on the grill
OMG! It’s all about the cumin - it makes these ribs stand out above other ribs. Outstanding!
I used this recipe for my first time making ribs, and they turned out great!! They stayed nice and juicy, and the flavor was delicious!

By far, the simplest recipe that produces the best results. I was a bit skeptical but tried it given all the great reviews. gave it enter and It was so easy to make!! We followed the instructions to the tee and they came out perfect. My family loved it, even my son who is a picky eater. There were no leftovers! This will become our go-to method for making ribs.
I made this and loved it! Great recipe and great taste all around!
Fantastic! Can’t wait to have them again. Thank you!

Should have allowed more cook time. It is winter here and the BBQ was on low and slow - but too slow. Should have left them on for 3 hours. Would add a little liquid in the foil wrap to accelerate the braising. All said - tasty!
Probably a great recipe, however I never could effectively trim the membrane sheath from the back of each rack, so kinda gave up and tossed them in the oven.
Great recipe. Easy to make with simple ingredients. Healthier than most recipes as it the rub does not contain sugar. I also used a sugar-free BBQ sauce. My whole family loves these ribs.

I changed rub ingredients to have salt, pepper, GrillMates BBQ sauce, and later BBQ Sauce. I started the grill with all 3 burners on high, and it got up to 550 F in about 10 minutes. The babyback ribs were put on the upper shelf, the area below was lined with silver foil to catch drippings. I lowered the lid and turned the heat down to Low.One hour later I opened the lid, added BBQ sauce on top, lowered the lid for 5 minutes. The inner temp was 189 so I put the ribs on the table and sliced them up. Very tasty! I'm not sure but I think they could have been a bit more tender (next time I'll let the temp get above 195). I highly recommend following cooking info exactly!

Easy and delicious and perfectly cooked following this recipe.
I doctored up my sweet baby ray’s bbq sauce with some honey, lemon and brown sugar and seasonings.

Followed directions exactly. Had never removed the membrane before this; was a bit pesky, but not difficult. Made the rub a couple of hours early to let flavors come together and rubbed the meat about an hour before grilling. Used a simple homemade BBQ sauce I’d used previously for pulled pork. These were delicious.

Added a mix of cayenne and black pepper. Difficult to judge “low” on the grill so I ended up cooking it for 1:20 until meat thermometer showed 170. Super easy recipe, the dry rub gave it nice heat and flavor - ribs stayed moist and perfectly done. Great recipe!
This recipe was so easy and delicious. I worried that my grill would cook too fast and I didn't have a second rack, but it was perfect and so good! Five stars!

So so so so SO so good!!! My review is for the cooking method, not the seasoning. We have a seasoning we love and used that instead of making our own!! We have a small Weber charcoal grill. We grilled one rack at 350° (it fluctuated between 300-400° for the whole time, but next time we make them, we’ll hold steady at 350°F!) for just over and hour and then put only about 1/2 C of sauce on for the last 5 minutes. Were they fall-off-the-bone tender? Not quite. But they WERE tender, easy to eat, and crazy delicious!!!! If you’re a rib snob that gets butthurt over not taking 4 hours to grill ribs, then this recipe isn’t for you. But if you want quick, delicious ribs, this is ABSOLUTELY for you!!!
Amazingly simple and delicious!
Cooked Low and slow and was way better.

I used this for ribs and it turned out great! I did use smoked paprika. I had a lot of the rub left, so I ended up keeping it and was grilling some salmon and added 2 tbsp. of brown sugar and a teaspoon of TruLime seasoning, grilled my filets on a cedar plank and it was some of the best Salmon ever!

OMG! It's true! It's worked just like it said. I was so worried I did not actually turn the grill all the way down to low. The ribs were a little over done but that was MY BAD. I have learned my lesson and I am making them today and I promise not to look. : )
Telling my son about them, totally doable for the working man and girl.
Absolutely fantastic! You can play with the spice mix, but if you follow the cooking directions, you’ll have ribs with meat falling off the bones.

My family love this! Changed bothing and will make
again. My husband says he likes it better than any restrant.

Just ok. The ribs were cooked through and moist with good flavor (can't go wrong with Sweet Baby Rays), but chewy and tough. I followed the instructions exactly. The spices were too spicy for my picky kids.
be light years better by leaving out (delete) the CUMIN ... that Cumin gives it a smell !!!
Simple and delicious. I added a little heat with cayenne but otherwise, this was perfect for my Weber on low for 60mins. Do use the foil to keep the flames away and DON'T OPEN the barb b cue.
I made no changes and they turned out perfect. I made them for the 4th of July and they were a hit.

I did better on this than I expected. The rub is fantastic, but I adjusted it to our taste. I doubled the brown sugar, did not use cumin, and just a dash of cayenne. I was a little worried that I didn’t get my grill hot enough, so for the last 20 minutes I turned the flame up. It didn’t over cook, and got just the right char on the top after brushing on the bbq sauce. I used pork ribs, but I’d like to try beef next time.
This is going to be easy. I followed the rules exactly and they were absolutely perfect. I did not change anything !

Truly prize winning! I had never been successful at ribs. I have a basic gas grill, and this technique worked beautifully. They turned out perfect - soft as butter on the inside but crispy/charred(ish) on the outside. Great proportions on spice, too. Since my gas grill doesn't go low enough I turned on one side and put the ribs on the other side (no flame) and just turned them so that both sides were closer to the burner at some point. Thanks for a great recipe!
The rub itself is absolutely amazing! Top it off with my favorite BBQ sauce...heaven! Best ribs I've had in a long time!
I cook it about a half hour more and add garlic powder.Time wise it might be because of our altitude. 6000 ft. tends to make everything take longer

Wonderful o fid change the mop sauce. To costal carolina and added.honey to rthe ribs. Eccellt receipt
.

I didn't have cumin, so substituted a blend of spices that were mostly what is listed in addition to the ones listed in the recipe. Also insteadof Kraft, I used Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ sauce. Other than that followed the recipe and it was delicious, simple, no fuss, no muss! This will be the recipe I use from now on, thank you!

All I can say is wow!! This was my first time making ribs, and I will only follow this recipe bc it works. At first I was a little skeptical about this dry rub but it was everything I was hoping for. My brother in law is a very picky eater and he was definitely loving the ribs. In fact everyone who had eaten them loved them. In addition to the listed seasonings I added Garlic salt, and of course Goya Adobo(being Puerto Rican this is a must). I made 3 racks so I added 3x the amount of ingredients. I did have difficulty removing the membrane off two of the racks so I left it on. Once seasoned I wrapped all the racks in foil and let sit over night. With foil on I cooked them on my gas grill low setting for 2 hours. After 2 hours took them out of the foil and brushed with some delicious bbq sauce. Left on the grill for about 10 minutes. Brushed more bbq sauce and remove. This was a definite home run.

Not a good cook. Just followed the recipe and truly the best ribs I ever tasted. Had so many disasters with ribs that my kids always laughed and said try again. This time perfection. After cooking I kept them warm wrapped in foil and on low in the crock pot.

My first time ever doing Baby Back Ribs on the charcoal grill and dare I say it was amazing!!!!! I did follow some other reviews & added 1 tsp each of onion powder & garlic powder, the rub was a must & then I chilled them in the fridge for a good 4 hours then 1-1/2 hrs on the grill, I did put alum foil on the grate though & put my ribs on there vs oiling the grill. Once I put the BBQ sauce on I took the foil off to crisp them up a bit. My husband raved about these & I honestly can't wait to make them again!!!
Used my own rub, baked in oven 1 hr at 300, then cooked as directed PERFECT!! everyone loved them!
These were the best ribs and easy to make. We cooked 2 slabs for a cookout and they were all gone, everyone loved them.

I followed the recipe exactly except made two racks of ribs and left bbq lid down for almost two hours without opening.. Basted ribs and then left lid closed for additional 15 mins. We loved the ribs! Thank you for this recipe.
I used some hickory smoke salt and some garlic in the rub. Wife thought they were great. She didn't even use sauce.

Was a little hesitant about the cooking time as I started the recipe. Well as I checked on the ribs (1) time while they were on the grill I knew it was going to be an awesome meal.

Great Recipe !! John
I didn't make any changes. I would make this again.
Very good. Will make again. Only additions were garlic and onion powder. Wrapped in foil and cooked 3 hours at 250 in oven.
